definitions.definition: The rear of the body , especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly .
examples: Could you please scratch my back ?
I hurt my back lifting those crates.

subdefinitions.definition: ( slang , uncountable ) Large and attractive buttocks .
( figurative ) The part of a piece of clothing which covers the back.
examples: I still need to finish the back of your dress.

subdefinitions.definition: The backrest , the part of a piece of furniture which receives the human back.
examples: Can you fix the back of this chair?

subdefinitions.definition: ( obsolete ) That part of the body that bears clothing. (Now used only in the phrase clothes on one's back .)

definitions.definition: That which is farthest away from the front.
examples: He sat in the back of the room.

subdefinitions.definition: The side of any object which is opposite the front or useful side. The edge of a book which is bound . ( printing ) The inside margin of a page. The side of a blade opposite the side used for cutting.
examples: Turn the book over and look at the back .
The titles are printed on the backs of the books.
Tap it with the back of your knife.

subdefinitions.definition: The reverse side; the side that is not normally seen.
examples: I hung the clothes on the back of the door.

subdefinitions.definition: Area behind, such as the backyard of a house or the rear storeroom of a retail store .
examples: We’ll meet out in the back of the library.
Are you sure you're totally out of hair gel? Could you please check in the back ?

subdefinitions.definition: The part of something that goes last .
examples: The car was near the back of the train.

subdefinitions.definition: ( sports ) In some team sports , a position behind most players on the team.
examples: The backs were lined up in an I formation.

definitions.definition: ( figuratively ) The upper part of a natural object which is considered to resemble an animal’s back.
examples: The small boat raced over the backs of the waves.

definitions.definition: A support or resource in reserve.
( nautical ) The keel and keelson of a ship.
examples: The ship’s back broke in the pounding surf.

definitions.definition: ( mining ) The roof of a horizontal underground passage.
A non-alcoholic drink (often water or a soft drink), to go with hard liquor or a cocktail.
examples: Could I get a martini with a water back ?

definitions.definition: Among leather dealers , one of the thickest and stoutest tanned hides .

main_definition: The rear of the body , especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly .
secondary_definitions: That which is farthest away from the front.
( figuratively ) The upper part of a natural object which is considered to resemble an animal’s back.
A support or resource in reserve.
( nautical ) The keel and keelson of a ship.
( mining ) The roof of a horizontal underground passage.
A non-alcoholic drink (often water or a soft drink), to go with hard liquor or a cocktail.
Among leather dealers , one of the thickest and stoutest tanned hides .

definitions.definition: A large shallow vat ; a cistern , tub , or trough , used by brewers, distillers, dyers, picklers, gluemakers, and others, for mixing or cooling wort , holding water, hot glue, etc.

main_definition: A large shallow vat ; a cistern , tub , or trough , used by brewers, distillers, dyers, picklers, gluemakers, and others, for mixing or cooling wort , holding water, hot glue, etc.
